operations.notes: All jobs both private and shared that are associated with a user.

parameters.description: The number of records to when returning the results. When paginating results, the page number = ceil(offset/limit)
parameters.name: offset

operations.summary: Get a list of jobs the authenticated user had submitted.

operations.notes: This is the sole point of submission for new jobs. Users must have permissions both on the app, execution host, and storage host to submit a job. Job requests are processed immediatly, however the actualy submission and execution happen asynchronously, so users are highly encouraged to leverage the callbackUrl parameter to receive notification of updates rather than polling.

parameters.description: The description of the job to submit. This can be either a file upload or json posted to the request body.
parameters.name: body

operations.summary: Get details of the job with the specific job id.

operations.notes: Using this method, users can stop a job that is currently running or resumbit the job for re-execution. If resubmitted, a new job will be created with the exact same inputs.
operations.summary: Perform an action on a job.

operations.notes: The job will be removed from the user's job history and will no longer show up in listing requests. Any archived data associated with this job will be unaffected. Once deleted, there is no way to recover the deleted job.
operations.summary: Deletes a job from the user's history.

apis.description: Get detailed job history containing every event in its history.

operations.notes: Users must have read access to this job to view the history.

parameters.description: The number of records to when returning the results. When paginating results, the page number = ceil(offset/limit)
parameters.name: offset

operations.summary: Get the history of this job.

operations.notes: Users must have read access to this job to view the permissions.

parameters.description: The number of records to when returning the results. When paginating results, the page number = ceil(offset/limit)
parameters.name: offset

operations.summary: Get the permission ACL for this job.

operations.notes: To delete a single user, set their permission to NONE or an empty string
operations.summary: Add or update a user's permission for an application.

operations.notes: This will reset the permissions such that only the user who submitted the job will be able to view it. Job owners cannot remove their own permissions.
operations.summary: Deletes all permissions on an job.

apis.description: Get job permission details for a specific user.

operations.notes: Users must have read access to this job to view the permissions.

parameters.description: The username of the api user associated with the permission.
parameters.name: username

parameters.description: The number of records to when returning the results. When paginating results, the page number = ceil(offset/limit)
parameters.name: offset

operations.summary: Get a specific user's permissions for a job.

operations.notes: To delete a single user, use the DELETE operation or set their permission to NONE or an empty string

parameters.description: The username of the api user associated with the permission
parameters.name: username

operations.summary: Add or update a user's permission for an job.

operations.notes: This will remove all permissions on an job for a user. Job owners cannot remote their own permissions.

parameters.description: The id of the application. The application id is made up of the name and version separated by a dash.
parameters.name: uniqueName

parameters.description: The username of the api user associated with the permission
parameters.name: username

operations.summary: Deletes all permissions for the given user on an job.

apis.description: Return just the status of the job

operations.summary: Get the status of the job.

apis.description: Return a listing of the output folder from the job.

operations.notes: If issued against an un-archived job, inputs and intermediate files will also be visible and accesible.

parameters.description: Path to an output file or folder relative to the job output directory. This resource will follow data around as it moves from the execution system to archival storage.
parameters.name: filePath

parameters.description: The number of records to when returning the results. When paginating results, the page number = ceil(offset/limit)
parameters.name: offset

operations.summary: List contents of a job's output directory.

operations.notes: This service will follow data around as it moves from the execution system to archival storage. You can use this endpoint to keep a permanent handle of the output of a job. Directory download is not currently supported.

parameters.description: Path to an output file relative to the job output directory.
parameters.name: filePath

operations.summary: Download an output file from a specific job.

appId.description: The unique name of the application being run by this job. This must be a valid application that the calling user has permission to run.
appId.name: appId

archive.description: Whether the output from this job should be archived. If true, all new files created by this application's execution will be archived to the archivePath in the user's default storage system.
archive.name: archive

archivePath.description: The path of the archive folder for this job on the user's default storage sytem.
archivePath.name: archivePath

archiveSystem.description: The unique id of the storage system on which this job's output will be staged.
archiveSystem.name: archiveSystem

batchQueue.description: The queue to which this job should be submitted. This is optional and only applies when the execution system has a batch scheduler.
batchQueue.name: batchQueue

endTime.description: The date the job stopped running due to termination, completion, or error in ISO 8601 format.
endTime.name: endTime

executionSystem.description: The system id of the execution system.
executionSystem.name: executionSystem

id.description: The unique id of the job.
id.name: id

inputs.description: The application specific input files needed for this job. These vary from application to application and should be entered as multiple individual parameters in the form. Inputs may be given as relative paths in the user's default storage system or as URI. If a URI is given, the data will be staged in by the IO service and made avaialble to the application at run time.
inputs.name: inputs

localId.description: The process or local job id of the job on the remote execution system.
localId.name: localId

maxRunTime.description: The requested compute time needed for this application to complete given in HH:mm:ss format.
maxRunTime.name: maxRunTime

memoryPerNode.description: The requested memory for this application to run given in GB.
memoryPerNode.name: memoryPerNode

message.description: The error message incurred when the job failed.
message.name: message

nodeCount.description: The number of processors this application should utilize while running. If the application is not of executionType PARALLEL, this should be 1.
nodeCount.name: nodeCount

notifications.description: An array of notifications you wish to receive.
notifications.name: notifications

outputPath.description: Relative path of the job's output data.
outputPath.name: outputPath

parameters.description: The application specific parameters needed for this job. These vary from application to application and should be entered as multiple individual parameters in the form. The actual dataType will be determined by the application description.
parameters.name: parameters

processorsPerNode.description: The number of processors this application should utilize while running. If the application is not of executionType PARALLEL, this should be 1.
processorsPerNode.name: processorsPerNode

retries.description: The number of retires it took to submit this job.
retries.name: retries

startTime.description: The date the job started in ISO 8601 format.
startTime.name: startTime

status.description: The status of the job. Possible values are: PENDING, STAGING_INPUTS, CLEANING_UP, ARCHIVING, STAGING_JOB, FINISHED, KILLED, FAILED, STOPPED, RUNNING, PAUSED, QUEUED, SUBMITTING, STAGED, PROCESSING_INPUTS, ARCHIVING_FINISHED, ARCHIVING_FAILED
status.name: status

submitTime.description: The date the job was submitted in ISO 8601 format.
submitTime.name: submitTime

workPath.description: The directory on the remote execution system from which the job is running.
workPath.name: workPath

description.description: A brief description of the event details.
description.name: description

status.description: The status of the job after this event.
status.name: status

parameter1.name: parameter1

action.description: Action to perform on the job.
action.name: action

parameter1.description: One or more parameters identified in the description of the app you're running.
parameter1.name: parameter1

Inputs may be given as relative paths in the user's default storage system or as URI. startTime.name: startTime

status.description: The status of the job. Possible values are: PENDING, STAGING_INPUTS, CLEANING_UP, ARCHIVING, STAGING_JOB, FINISHED, KILLED, FAILED, STOPPED, RUNNING, PAUSED, QUEUED, SUBMITTING, STAGED, PROCESSING_INPUTS, ARCHIVING_FINISHED, ARCHIVING_FAILED
status.name: status

event.description: The event you wish to recieve a notification about. Specify * for all events.
event.name: event

persistent.description: Whether this event should remain active after it triggers the first time.
persistent.name: persistent

url.description: The URI to notify when the import is complete. This can be an email address or URL. If a URL is given, a POST will be made to this address. URL templating is supported. Valid template values are: ${JOB_STATUS}, ${JOB_URL}, ${JOB_ID}, ${JOB_SYSTEM}, ${JOB_NAME}, ${JOB_START_TIME}, ${JOB_END_TIME}, ${JOB_SUBMIT_TIME}, ${JOB_ARCHIVE_PATH}, ${JOB_ARCHIVE_URL}, ${JOB_ERROR}
url.name: url

name.description: Unique name of the application to which this permissions apply.
name.name: name

format.description: The file type of the file.
format.name: format

lastModified.description: The date this file was last modified in ISO 8601 format.
lastModified.name: lastModified

mimeType.description: The mime type of the file/folder. If unknown, it defaults to application/binary.
mimeType.name: mimeType

path.description: The absolute path to the file/folder.
path.name: path

permissions.description: The system permission of the invoking user on the file/folder.
permissions.name: permissions

system.description: The systemId of the system where this file lives.
system.name: system

type.description: Whether it is a file or folder.
type.name: type
